title: Calulating Equilibrium Temperature
text: To find the temperature at which water is in equilibrium, we need to use the Gibbs Free Energy equation for phase equilibria: $$ΔG=0$$.

title: Understanding Gibbs Free Energy at Equilibrium
text: The equation for Gibbs Free Energy at equilibrium is: $$ΔG=ΔH-TΔS$$.

title: Rearranging the Equation
text: Since $$ΔG=0$$ at equilibrium, the equation becomes $$0=ΔH-TΔS$$. Rearrange it to solve for T: $$T=\frac{\Delta H}{\Delta S}$$.

title: Substitute Given Values
text: Now substitute the given values: $$ΔH=40.79$$ $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$ and $$ΔS=109.2$$ $$\frac{J}{K}$$ mol.

title: Calculate the Temperature
text: Convert kJ to J: ΔH becomes 40,790 $$\frac{J}{mol}$$. Calculate $$T=40, 790$$ $$\frac{J}{mol}$$ ÷ $$109.2$$ $$\frac{J}{K}$$ mol.
